item.title: Peak Releases New Update for September 2025
item.description:
Peak has received a brand-new update that brings a slew of bug fixes and balance improvements, as well as a long-requested accessibility feature. Dubbed Patch 1.28.a, the latest Peak update joins a long and frequent cadence of support for the indie hit from developer Aggro Crab.

Having debuted on Steam in June, Peak has turned out to be one of the surprise breakout successes of 2025. The indie climbing and exploration title sold over 10 million copies as of July, outperforming several high-profile AAA releases. Peak 's popularity stems from its novel blend of fun co-op exploration, challenging traversal mechanics, and constant developer support.

Following the release of Peak 's first major update — dubbed "Mesa" — last month, Aggro Crab has now issued Patch 1.28.a for the game. The highlight of Patch 1.28.a is the introduction of a Color Blindness Mode , a feature Peak players have been asking for since launch. This new setting adds patterns to Peak 's colored berries, making them easier to distinguish for players with different types of color blindness. Collecting resources and keeping track of items is essential during climbs in Peak , so the addition of the Color Blindness Mode makes a significant difference in accessibility.

Furthermore, Peak Patch 1.28.a delivers a wide variety of balance adjustments and bug fixes. Tornadoes, one of Peak 's environmental hazards, have been reworked: the time before the first tornado appears has been reduced, while the minimum time between spawns has been increased. The notorious Tornado Hell biome variant in Peak is also less common. Nest Eggs now weigh more appropriately, and backpacks benefit from new physics designed to reduce accidental losses. On the bug-fix front, major longstanding Peak issues like the inability to unlock the Endurance Badge, game freezes caused by tornadoes, and NPC pathfinding quirks have all been resolved.

Though Patch 1.28.a is fairly modest compared to Peak 's Mesa Update, the addition of the Color Blindness Mode is still very welcome. Greater accessibility means a larger gamut of players who'd be willing to try out Peak , and Aggro Crab's addressal of frustrating bugs and gameplay balance issues further helps keep the game welcoming and fair.

Peak Update 1.28.a Full Patch Notes

Features

  • Color Blindness Mode: Adds patterns to differently-colored berries to further differentiate them.

Balance

  • Reduced the maximum time before the first tornado can spawn.
  • Slightly increased the minimum time before a tornado can spawn again.
  • Slightly reduced the commonness of the "Tornado Hell" biome variant.
  • It is now way less likely that the maze is blocked after entering the TOMB.
  • Nest Eggs now weigh more to match the weight of the Egg inside.

Major Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where players would be unable to obtain the Endurance Badge.
  • Fixed an issue where The Scoutmaster couldn't climb walls. This went unnoticed for a while because he can jump pretty high, but now he should be even scarier.
  • Fixed an issue where Scrolls and Berrynanas and other objects that change form when used would drop the new item instead of putting it in your hands.
  • Fixed a potential issue where playing a vanilla game after previously having visual mods installed (or playing with a modded player while not having their same mods installed) could cause a variety of visual and functionality issues. This could include, but was not limited to, players permanently showing up as a default skin in the endgame screen even if not wearing modded cosmetics, as well as the endgame report breaking entirely and preventing certain achievements from being obtained.
  • Fixed an issue where, rarely, getting caught in a tornado would cause the game to freeze on the loading screen upon failing a run.
  • Backpack has new physics that should prevent more cases where people would lose their backpack.

Minor Fixes

  • Fixed an issue where the Magic Bugle and Scoutmaster's Bugle play at a strangely low volume.
  • The Guidebook renders at a higher resolution if you set the Render Scale to low.
  • Fixed an issue where placing a Scout Cannon atop a jellyfish could cause a softlock.
  • A missing treetop has been added to a branch on the giant tree.
  • Removed the annoying flicker on the endgame countdown.
  • Removed Scoutmaster grain effect in Photosensitive Mode.
  • Rainbow stamina bar is now slower in Photosensitive Mode.
  • Fixed an issue where it said "Move" instead of "Interact" on a prompt in the Controls page.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Silksong: Where to Find Jubilana in Wandering Merchant Quest
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong is jam-packed with content that players can indulge in when they're not gunning for the final boss to complete the game. After reaching the Citadel in Act Two, you can restore the bell inside the First Shrine tower in Songclave to transform the area into a safe harbor for NPCs to settle in.

The area will eventually become an NPC hub, where players will be able to take on the Wandering Merchant from the Wish Wall to unlock the vendor for the area, Jubilana. Unlocking this merchant in the Songclave area of the Citadel is quite important, as she sells some of the most important items in the game, including a tool called Ascendant's Grip (piton). This tool will make platforming and climbing a lot easier for players, and here's how to complete the quest to get it.

How to Start the Wandering Merchant Quest in Silksong

To start the Wandering Merchant quest, players will need to revisit the Songclave area of the Citadel after ringing the bell inside the First Shrine in Silksong . This time around, there will be a host of NPCs taking refuge around the area, as the Caretaker predicted.

You'll need to simply head over to the Wishboard and start the quest "The Wandering Merchant," which will set Hornet on a search for Jubilana, a pilgrim merchant who's gone missing inside the halls of Coral Chambers. So, you'll need to head to the Coral Chambers' larger vertical area to start investigating Jubilana's disappearance.

Where to Find Jubilana & Unlock Her as a Merchant

Once players enter the larger vertical area of the Coral Chambers, right after Songclave, they'll spot a pile of bodies on top of a platform to the left . Interacting with the bodies will allow the Hornet to track Jubilana's movement and hone in on her location.

Keep following Jubilana's trail, as you'll encounter more bodies along the way that will help you pinpoint her location. After making your way through the hallways, you'll eventually reach the smaller vertical area of the Coral Chambers. Jubilana's trail will lead you inside one of the rooms to the left , which will have a bunch of enemies that you'll need to defeat.

After the enemies are defeated, Jubilana will jump out of her hiding place and reveal herself to Hornet. After a short conversation, The Wandering Merchant quest will be completed, and Jubilana will head to Songclave to set up her shop .

Head back to Songclave, and you'll find Jubilana to the right of the First Shrine in Silksong . Check out her offerings, and make sure to buy the Ascendant's Grip (piton). This is one of the best traversal tools that you can equip to help you stick to walls indefinitely. It's especially helpful when you're platforming through a tricky area, and need to stick to a wall to plan your next movement.

item.title: All NBA 2K26 Dribble Animation Requirements
item.description:
You can customize your player's dribble animations in NBA 2K26 to match your favorite NBA all-star, but you need to meet certain attribute and height requirements in order to use them. If you have a specific animation style in mind for your player, then you'll have to plan your NBA 2K26 build ahead of time.

Dribble animations may not be as game-changing as shooting animations or badge requirements, but they can still be a huge help on the court. This is especially true if you're a point guard that needs to drive the ball past defenders or a player who frequently cuts to the basket for close shots and layups. These are all the dribble animation requirements in NBA 2K26 .

Dribble Style Requirements in NBA 2K26

These are the attribute and height requirements for every dribble style animation in NBA 2K26 .

item.title: All Hollow Knight Silksong Crests (List and Locations)
item.description:
There are seven crests in Hollow Knight: Silksong , each of which has its own unique ability and tool layout. With the exception of the Hunter Crest, players can unlock new slots for their crests using Memory Lockets, with the Hunter Crest upgrades tied to the total number of Memory Lockets that players have used.

By speaking with Eva after using a certain number of lockets, it's also possible to get two special Vesticrests, which grant access to one additional Yellow (four lockets) and Blue (twelve lockets) slot for all seven Hollow Knight: Silksong crests. Unsurprisingly, the best crests typically become available toward the end of the game.

Where to Find the Hunter Crest

Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes. Build focus with successive strikes.

The Hunter Crest is Hornet's default crest and will be available from the very start of the game. After they find Needolin in Bellhart, players can upgrade the Hunter Crest by speaking with Eva in the southeastern part of Weavenest Atla.

  • Initial Slots : 1 Red, 1 Blue, 1 Yellow, and 1 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 2 Red, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow, and 1 White

Where to Find the Reaper Crest

Attack with heavy, arcing slashes and reap additional Silk from enemies.

Players will get the Reaper Crest as a reward for completing the Chapel of the Reaper, which can be found inside a cave on the west side of Greymoor.

  • Initial Slots : 1 Red, 1 Blue, 1 Yellow, and 1 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 2 Red, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow, and 1 White

Where to Find the Wanderer Crest

Cut swiftly and nimbly with short, precise strikes.

Players will get the Wanderer Crest as a reward for completing the Chapel of the Wanderer, which can be found inside a cave in the Bonegrave area of Moss Grotto.

  • Initial Slots : 1 Red, 0 Blue, 2 Yellow, and 1 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 1 Red, 2 Blue, 3 Yellow, and 1 White

Where to Find the Beast Crest

Tear foes with savage slashes. Bind to enter a wild fury and steal life from prey.

Players will get the Beast Crest as a reward for completing the Chapel of the Beast, which can be found inside a cave on the east side of Hunter's March.

  • Initial Slots : 2 Red, 0 Blue, 0 Yellow, and 1 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 2 Red, 0 Blue, 2 Yellow, and 1 White

Where to Find the Witch Crest

Whip the needle in sweeping swings. Leech the life of foes through twisted roots.

Players will get the Witch Crest as a reward for completing the Infestation Operation Wish for Greyroot in the northwestern part of Greymoor.

  • Initial Slots : 1 Red, 1 Blue, 0 Yellow, and 1 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 2 Red, 3 Blue, 0 Yellow, and 1 White

Where to Find the Architect Crest

Spin the needle as a screw, shredding foes. Spend Silk to rapidly craft new tools.

Players will get the Architect Crest as a reward for completing the Chapel of the Architect, which can be found inside a cave in the Cauldron area of Underworks.

  • Initial Slots : 3 Red, 0 Blue, 0 Yellow, and 0 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 3 Red, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow, and 0 White

Where to Find the Shaman Crest

Cast the blade forward and empower Silk Skills with powerful runes.

Players will get the Shaman Crest in the Ruined Chapel during Silksong 's third act. To reach it, they'll need to use the Silk Soar skill while standing in front of the lore tablet.

  • Initial Slots : 0 Red, 0 Blue, 0 Yellow, and 3 White
  • Upgraded Slots : 0 Red, 2 Blue, 0 Yellow, and 3 White

What's the Best Crest in Silksong?

The best crest in Silksong is undoubtedly the Shaman's Crest , which allows players to equip three white tools/silk skills at the same time. Granted, it doesn't have any slots for red or yellow tools, but after acquiring both Vesticrests, players can at least equip one of the latter as well as three blue tools. The Architect Crest is a close second, as being able to equip three red tools can be a real game-changer during certain boss fights, and it can be acquired much earlier in the game. Last but not least is the Reaper Crest, which makes for a fantastic early-game crest, beating out the Hunter Crest thanks to its ability to generate additional Silk.

item.title: Silksong: How to Get Crawbug Ragpelts (Crawbug Clearing Quest)
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong lets players take on and complete Wishes from various NPCs that inhabit Pharloom to get some nice rewards in exchange. After lifting Bellhart's curse and restoring its residents to their cheerful lifestyle, you'll be able to pick up Wishes from the quest Wishwall (quest board) in the area. One of these wishes is Crawbug Clearing, which will require players to visit the Creige of Halfway Home and deliver them Crawbug Ragpelts. Here's a complete guide to help you complete this quest.

How to Start Crawbug Clearing Wish in Silksong

After completing the Threadspun Town quest in Silksong , players will successfully break the curse of Bellhart and rescue its citizens from the grasp of the Widow. Once that happens, players can check out the Wishwall next to the vendor to take on the Crawbug Clearing quest, which will require them to visit the Halfway Home Inn inside the Greymoor area.

After reaching the Halfway Home Inn, talk to the Creige, and he'll explain how some Craws have nested atop his establishment. These Craws have even started attacking Pilgrims who come to seek refuge in Halfway Home Inn, disrupting business. Creige will ask Hornet to bring in 25 Crawbug Ragpelts to help him construct a scarecrow at the top, which will solve the issue.

So, here's how players can easily get the Crawbug Ragpelts and complete the Crawbug Clearing quest in Silksong .

Where to Find Crawbug Ragpelts

There are two ways to acquire the Crawbug Ragpelts for this quest. The first one is heading to the Craw Lake area, the rightmost part of Greymoor, and hunting down Crawbugs. Alternatively, players can farm the Crawbug Ragpelts right atop the Halfway Home Inn. Let's focus on the latter option to make things easier.

  1. Exit Halfway Home from the east entrance (left side).
  2. Climb the platforms right outside to get on top of the building.
  3. Two Crawbugs will spawn at the roof, which you can eliminate to get two Crawbug Ragpelts.
  4. Once both Crawbugs are defeated, head back down.
  5. Enter the Halfway Home, and then leave to respawn the Crawbugs on the roof.
  6. Repeat the process until you've acquired 25 Crawbug Ragpelts.

After returning 25 Crawbug Ragpelts to the Creige of Halfway Home, the Crawbug Clearing quest will be marked as complete in Silksong. Players will receive a crafting kit expansion as a reward , increasing the damage Hornet deals with her tools.
